intro: Lasianthus bulusanensis, commonly known as the Bulusan mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It typically grows in forest understories and is adapted to humid, shaded environments. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
